content: By: Rand Fishkin March 21, 2011 Headsmacking Tip #18: Use Discussion Search as Competitive Intel Competitive Research Most of us in the search field have likely seen the addition of "Discussions" to Google's search options. It lets searchers specifically target either forums or Q+A sites for their queries (or both, by default), and it's a gold mine for competitive intelligence and research.... Read this post By: Benjamin Estes March 20, 2011 Defining Your True Competitors Competitive Research Businesses seeking SEO often know who their real world competitors are but don't have a good idea who their competitors are in the SERPs. I examine one powerful method to figure this out. We spend our days researching, creating, implementing, and then measuring the success of our efforts.
